title.native: ポケットモンスター ベストウイッシュ シーズン2

description: Satoshi, Iris & Dent continue their travels through the Isshu region. After successfully winning his eighth and final Gym Badge against Homika in Tachiwaki City, Shirona invites everyone to stay at her villa in East Isshu, where old friend Hikari is also staying and where they participate in the Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup after which Satoshi participates in the Isshu League. Team Rocket, meanwhile, initiate their final plan for the Isshu region-what is their purpose in their desire for the legendary Pokémon Meloetta?
synonyms: Pokémon Nero e Bianco: Destini Rivali
Pokémon Černý a Bílý: Opačné Osudy
Pokémon Schwarz & Weiß: Rivalen des Schicksals
Pokémon Czerń i Biel: Ścieżki Przeznaczenia
Pokémon Preto e Branco: Destinos Rivais
Покемон: Чёрное и Белое - Судьбы Соперников
Pokémon Negro y Blanco: Destinos Rivales
Pokémon Siyah ve Beyaz: Rakip Yazgılar﻿

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rica_matsumoto3) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ricachanhouse) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%BE%E6%9C%AC%E6%A2%A8%E9%A6%99) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rika_Matsumoto)

Rika Matsumoto is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer, as well as one of the founders of [JAM Project](https://anilist.co/staff/102041/).

After early stage work, she began both voice acting and singing careers. The most popular role by Rika is [Satoshi](https://anilist.co/character/2473/) (Ash Ketchum in English translations), the main character of the anime series [Pokémon](https://anilist.co/anime/527/). She also had a role in the [Yu-Gi-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/550/) series as [Ryou Bakura](https://anilist.co/character/1488/) and [Yami Bakura](https://anilist.co/character/1489/). As such, Matsumoto has taken on roles for young boys. Matsumoto also performs the songs for many of the openings for the Japanese Pokémon anime.

Matsumoto has had lead or supporting roles in dozens of series. She has also had a radio show in Japan and does some dubbing work for translations of American films and TV series into Japanese. She announced in April 2008 she was taking time off from the group and her solo work.

Her name is also sometimes romanized as Rica Matsumoto.
Satoshi is the creator of Pocket Monsters and Game Freak company

Shinji Miyazaki  is a Japanese composer and arranger. He was born in Kobe, and lived in a variety of areas on the island of Shikoku for much of his childhood. He developed a taste for pop music, which eventually led him to study musical arrangement and piano instruction at the Shobi College of Music. He took some time in deciding that music would become his career, but eventually decided to become an arranger, and later a composer.

His work has dealt primarily with musical scores for anime. His most well known contributions include music for the Crayon Shin-chan series and music for much of the Pokémon anime series and most of the films in it from 1997 to 2019. His work pulls from many inspirations, among them J-Pop and American pop influences, as well as jazz artist Gil Evans. Many of his compositions utilize string and brass instruments, particularly the french horn.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Ken Sugimori is a Japanese video game designer, illustrator, manga artist, and director. He is most famous as the character designer and art director for the Pokémon franchise. Sugimori is also credited with the art direction for other titles, including Pulseman.  

Sugimori drew all of the original 151 Pokémon himself. He has worked on the various Pokémon movies, trading cards, and other games like the Super Smash Bros. series. From early 1981 until 1986, Sugimori illustrated a gaming fanzine called Game Freak, which had been started by Satoshi Tajiri. Sugimori discovered the magazine in a doujinshi shop, and decided to get involved. Eventually, the two decided to pitch an arcade game design idea to Namco; they reworked Game Freak into a development company and produced Mendel Palace. 

Sugimori is most famous as the character designer and art director for the Pokémon franchise. He has worked on the various Pokémon movies, trading cards, and other games. For Pokémon Black and White, Sugimori directed a team of 17 people in designing new characters for the games, though he always drew the final designs. He drew much of his inspiration from observing animals in aquariums and zoos. 

Sugimori has also written and illustrated original manga, including one which was distributed with pre-orders of Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness. When he begins a new character, his process normally involves making a rough sketch, then tracing it on to film paper while polishing it and making the illustration more professional looking. After that, he draws the character many times, changing its proportions until he is satisfied.

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

While studying at Tokyo University of the Arts, Kotabe was impressed by the film [The Tale of the White Serpent](https://anilist.co/anime/4513/) and the animator [Yasuji Mori](https://anilist.co/staff/103602/), and immediately applied to work at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

His first project there was [Magic Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/4948/), the first ever anime to be released theatrically in North America. At the studio he also met [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/) and [Isao Takahata](https://anilist.co/staff/100579/), with whom he later left in order to work at A Pro, and they began work on an adaptation of Pippi Longstocking. That project was eventually canceled, and work began on the two-film series [Panda! Go Panda!](https://anilist.co/anime/2611/).

Kotabe then worked as character designer on two highly influential series directed by Takahata: [Heidi, Girl of the Alps](https://anilist.co/anime/2225/), and [3000 Leagues in Search of Mother](https://anilist.co/anime/1663/). Miyazaki also took part working on scene design and layouts.

In 1985, he was scouted by Nintendo and assumed the position of the game development advisor. He worked at Nintendo for over two decades until leaving in 2007.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Robin Ericsson is a Swedish musician. He got 6th place in the 2008 season of the Swedish version of Idol
**Stine Skårdal Jensen** is a Norwegian singer and voice actress.
Audhild Jerdal is a Norwegian dubbing instructor, recording technician, translator and sound supervisor.
Asbjørn Tveit is a Norwegian translator
